Package: gov.noaa.messageapi.interfaces

[Java] Interface IConnection

  • An IConnection is an instantiation of an IEndpoint - Connections are provided specific versions of the Endpoint required initialization parameters, and a separate object is created for every Connection in the session manifest. Connections contain metadata related to Endpoint instances, including what classifiers, collections, and transformations are associated with the Endpoint. Connections should have globally unique Ids for a given session manifest.

    Authors:
    Ryan Berkheimer

        Returns a map of classifiers associated with the Connection.

        Returns a list of the collections associated with the Connection.
        IConnection getCopy()
        Returns a deep copy of the Connection

        Returns the ID associated with the Connection

    • Method Detail

      • public java.util.List<java.lang.Object> getClassiferValues(java.lang.String classifierKey)

        Returns all values for a given classifier key in the connection classifier map.

      • public java.util.Map<java.lang.String, java.util.List<java.lang.Object>> getClassifiers()

        Returns a map of classifiers associated with the Connection.

      • public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getCollections()

        Returns a list of the collections associated with the Connection.

      • public IConnection getCopy()

        Returns a deep copy of the Connection

      • public java.lang.String getEndpointClass()

        Returns the EndpointClass used to initialize the endpoint connection. This class is a fully qualified, namespaced class on the Java classpath.

      • public java.util.Map<java.lang.String, java.lang.Object> getEndpointConstructor()

        Returns a map of constructor parameters used to initialize the endpoint constructor.

      • public java.lang.String getId()

        Returns the ID associated with the Connection

      • public java.util.Map<java.lang.String, java.util.Map<java.lang.String, java.lang.Object>> getTransformationMap()

        Returns a map of transformations associated with the Connection. This map includes the transformation ids along with their connection parameters.

      • public IPacket process(IProtocolRecord record)

        The method that is called when the request is submitted and the endpoint connection is called into. This method takes a protocol record (one to one association with the connection) and returns a packet.
